001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.utils.Pair;
005
006import java.util.List;
007
008/**
009 * A loss function implementation that computes the sum of errors
010 * rather than their mean.
011 *
012 * <p>
013 * {@code SummedError} can operate at both the sample level
014 * ({@link SampleLossFunction}) and the batch level
015 * ({@link BatchLossFunction}). Instead of averaging errors,
016 * it aggregates them by summation, producing a larger value as the
017 * number of dimensions or samples increases.
018 * </p>
019 *
020 * <p>
021 * This approach is useful in contexts where the absolute magnitude of
022 * the error across dimensions or samples is important, or where mean
023 * aggregation would dilute the contribution of individual errors.
024 * </p>
025 *
026 * <p>
027 * Typical usage includes situations where cumulative loss across all
028 * outputs or samples is desired, rather than a normalized mean value.
029 */
030@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
031public class SummedError implements SampleLossFunction, BatchLossFunction {
032
033    /**
034     * {@inheritDoc}
035     */
036    @Override
037    public float calculateBatchLoss(List<Pair<float[], float[]>> batch, Pair<SampleLossFunction, List<DimensionLossFunction>> lossFunctions) {
038        float loss = 0.0f;
039        for (Pair<float[], float[]> sample : batch) {
040            loss += lossFunctions.left().calculateSampleLoss(sample, lossFunctions.right());
041        }
042        return loss;
043    }
044
045    /**
046     * {@inheritDoc}
047     */
048    @Override
049    public float calculateSampleLoss(Pair<float[], float[]> sample, List<DimensionLossFunction> lossFunctions) {
050        float loss = 0.0f;
051        float[] estimated = sample.left();
052        float[] target = sample.right();
053        int dimension = estimated.length;
054        for (int i = 0; i < dimension; i++) {
055            loss += get(lossFunctions, i).calculateDimensionLoss(estimated[i], target[i]);
056        }
057        return loss;
058    }
059
060    /**
061     * {@inheritDoc}
062     */
063    @Override
064    public float[] determineGradients(float[] estimated, float[] target, List<DimensionLossFunction> lossFunctions) {
065        int dimension = estimated.length;
066        float[] gradients = new float[dimension];
067        for (int i = 0; i < dimension; i++) {
068            gradients[i] = get(lossFunctions, i).determineGradient(estimated[i], target[i]);
069        }
070        return gradients;
071    }
072
073}
